stories.title: Dollar Under Pressure; Stocks, Futures Mixed: Markets Wrap
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The dollar extended recent declines as traders squared positions ahead of year-end. Asian stocks, U.S. and European futures were mixed amid fading prospects for bigger government aid checks to individuals.
abstract: S&P 500 slips; U.S. small caps have largest drop in a month
Covid variant discovered in U.S.; U.K. faces tighter curbs

stories.title: McConnell Rebuffs Trump, Democrats by Blocking $2,000 Checks
stories.summary: President Trump says failure to act is a "death wish" by Republicans.
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: President Trump says failure to act is a "death wish" by Republicans.
abstract: Democrats seek unanimous support for House-passed bill
President says failure to act a ‘death wish’ by Republicans

stories.title: Convicted Spy Pollard Arrives in Israel at End of Saga With U.S.
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Convicted spy Jonathan Pollard, a former U.S. Navy intelligence analyst imprisoned for 30 years for passing classified information to Israel, arrived there early Wednesday, ending a saga that had long strained relations between the close allies.

stories.title: U.K. Housing Boom Pushes Price Growth to Six-Year High
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: U.K. house price growth rose to a six-year high in December, rounding off a strong 2020 for the market that defied a wider economic downturn.

stories.title: AstraZeneca-Oxford Covid Vaccine Gains First Clearance With U.K. Nod
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: AstraZeneca Plc and the University of Oxford’s Covid-19 vaccine won U.K. clearance, marking the first approval worldwide for a shot that’s faced questions but will be key to mass immunizations.
abstract: Vaccinations to start in new year as cases rise across Britain
Recipients to get second shot within 12 weeks of first one

stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Welcome to Wednesday, Europe. Here’s the latest news and analysis from Bloomberg Economics to help you start the day:
abstract: EU, Chinese leaders set to give blessing to investment deal

stories.title: Iran to Use Money From Iraq Gas Sale to Buy Virus Vaccine
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Iran will use money from energy exports to Iraq to buy coronavirus vaccine from Europe, Energy Minister Reza Ardakanian said.

stories.title: Brexit Border Chaos Forces Truckers to Shun U.K. Deliveries
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: European freight forwarders are rejecting contracts to take loads into the U.K. due to fears the chaos at Dover could be repeated post-Brexit.
abstract: Freight forwarders are backing out of taking cargo to Britain
Hauliers fear they could be stuck in queues without toilets

stories.title: Fake Halal Meat Scandal in Muslim-Majority Malaysia Fuels Anger
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: A meat-fraud scandal is roiling Malaysia after a local news outlet uncovered a cartel that allegedly bribed customs officials in order to smuggle in all kinds of meat and label it halal, triggering outrage in the Muslim-majority country.
abstract: Cartel mixed horse, kangaroo meat with beef and sold as halal
Scandal undermines goal to become a global halal export hub

stories.title: Germany’s New Virus Deaths Surpass 1,000 for the First Time
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Germany’s new coronavirus deaths surpassed 1,000 for the first time since the beginning of the pandemic, just days after the country started its vaccination campaign.
abstract: There were 1,122 deaths in the 24 hours through Wednesday
Rise in deaths comes as Berlin considers extending shutdown

stories.title: Some of 2020’s Most Expensive Stocks Sink in Year-End Selloff
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Some of the year’s most expensive stocks encountered a wave of selling as investors moved to lock in gains in the last week of 2020.

stories.title: Qualtrics Files for U.S. IPO Two Years After Sale to SAP
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Qualtrics International Inc. filed for what could be one of the first U.S. initial public offerings of 2021, just over two years after it was acquired by German software giant SAP SE.
abstract: IPO may give software maker fully diluted value of $14 billion
Silver Lake to invest $550 million in a private placement

stories.title: Ant Considers Holding Company With Regulation Similar to Bank, Sources Say
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Jack Ma’s besieged Ant Group Co. is planning to fold its financial operations into a holding company that could be regulated more like a bank, according to people familiar with the situation, potentially crippling the growth of its most-profitable units.
abstract: Financial units face stricter regulation in planned structure
Lifestyle businesses to be excluded from holding company

stories.title: Seychelles Bans Gatherings, Shuts Schools as Virus Cases Rise
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Seychelles, an Indian Ocean archipelago that is dependent on tourism and fisheries, has reintroduced strict measures after nine people in the local community tested positive for Covid-19.

stories.title: Sinopharm Says Shot 79% Effective and Seeks General Use in China
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: State-backed vaccine developer China National Biotec Group Co. said one of its shots is effective in preventing Covid-19 in 79.3% of people, allowing it to apply for authorization to market the inoculation for use in the general population.
abstract: Efficacy rate is below levels shown by Pfizer, Moderna shots
Shot could be one of first in world approved for general use

stories.title: Human-Run Hedge Funds Trounce Quants in Covid Year
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Turns out, the hedge fund industry’s swashbucklers haven’t been made obsolete by the machines just yet.
abstract: Coatue, Tiger, Viking pace stock-pickers to top returns in ‘20
Market tumult upended some of the best-known quant behemoths
stories.byline: Hema Parmar, Katherine Burton and Nishant Kumar

stories.title: These Are the Themes That Defined 2020 in European Stocks
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The winners and losers in a wild 2020 for European stocks were determined by what defined the year for everyone: a global pandemic.
abstract: Work-from-home, renewable-energy shares are star performers
Fossil fuels, travel stocks and banks are Stoxx 600 laggards

stories.title: Indian Stocks Fluctuate After Five-Day Rally to Record Highs
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: India stocks drifted between gains and losses following a five-day rally, as the nation’s daily count of fresh reported coronavirus cases dropped to a six-month low.

stories.title: China Revises Down 2019 GDP Growth to 6% on Lower Manufacturing
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: China revised down its official GDP growth rate for 2019 to 6% from 6.1%, mainly due to a lower estimate for manufacturing output, a change that will make it slightly easier for officials to report economic expansion this year.
abstract: Revision makes it slightly easier to report growth in 2020
Manufacturing sector saw largest revision: statistics bureau

stories.title: Global Crisis Debt Is Fine for Citizens Ruing Tough Times Ahead
abstract: YouGov poll finds backing for fiscal splurge to aid economies
Consumers have bleak view for their own incomes, living costs

stories.title: Singapore’s Top Developer Woes Grow Over China Investment
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The internal woes of Singapore’s second-largest listed developer, City Developments Ltd., continued to escalate after a second board member resigned over disagreements on an investment in China.
abstract: CDL’s board member resigns over Sincere Property Group deal
The Chairman’s cousin quit over similar reason previously

stories.title: Traders See Cash Tightening in India to Drive Bond Playbook
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: India’s sovereign bond investors are converging on a trade idea for 2021. They’re betting that short-term yields would rebound as the central bank soaks up excess cash on signs of an economic recovery.
abstract: Short-end rates priced aggressively on excess cash: Quantum
Nomura sees liquidity withdrawal starting in 2Q 2021

modules.title: The most important market news of the day.

stories.title: Muddy Waters’ Carson Block on Short Selling
stories.summary: Carson Block, Chief Investment Officer of Muddy Waters Capital LLC and famed short seller speaks to Bloomberg's Tracy Alloway at the Bloomberg Invest Global virtual summit about the wirecard scandal, what markets he’s looking at besides China and how he gets his “tips.” (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Fed Caps Bank Dividends, Bans Share Buybacks Through September
stories.summary: The Federal Reserve told the biggest U.S. banks they can’t increase dividends or resume buybacks through at least the third quarter as uncertainty over the course of a global pandemic weighs on lenders. Bloomberg's Mike McKee reports on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?" (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: MSCI’s Henry Fernandez on COVID Redefining ESG
stories.summary: Henry Fernandez, Chairman and CEO of MSCI speaks to Bloomberg's Mallika Kapur at the Bloomberg Invest Global virtual summit about the rise in ESG investing and how social norms and the pursuit of equality will influence ESG investing going forward. (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Consumers to Feel Long Shadow of Virus for Quite Some Time: Yale’s Roach
stories.summary: Yale University’s Stephen Roach examines what the world can learn from how China reopens its economy and the long-lasting effects of the coronavirus pandemic. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Prestige Economics President on the Future After COVID-19
stories.summary: Prestige Economics President Jason Schenker discusses the financial risks and the opportunities in a post-pandemic world. He speaks to Romaine Bostick and Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

stories.title: Cryptocurrency XRP Is in Free Fall With Exchanges Delisting Coin
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: XRP continued its plunge after Coinbase became the latest U.S. crypto exchange to remove the world’s fourth-biggest coin in the wake of an SEC lawsuit against Ripple Labs Inc.
abstract: XRP is down nearly 40% since being delisted by Coinbase
A slew of exchanges delisted the coin following SEC lawsuit

stories.title: NFL’s Russell Okung to Get 50% of His $13 Million Salary in Bitcoin
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The Carolina Panthers tackle is the first National Football League player to collect a portion of his check in the cryptocurrency.

stories.title: Bitcoin Faces Regulatory Scrutiny After Record-Breaking Rally
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: It’s been a tough year by all accounts. But for Bitcoin, 2020 has been a marvelous time.
abstract: Treasury, SEC views seen looming large on 2021 crypto outlook
Deutsche Bank survey found a majority of investors are bullish

stories.title: Bitcoin Crushes Doubters as 224% Rally Proves It’s Here to Stay
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Bitcoin just won’t go away. The original cryptocurrency again had commentators eating their words in 2020 -- yours truly included. It’s now time to accept it’s here to stay.
abstract: Demand has proven to be impervious to wild price swings
Bitcoin supply was pinched off in halving of reward to miners

stories.title: Perella Weinberg Inks Deal With Betsy Cohen’s SPAC
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Boutique investment bank Perella Weinberg Partners has agreed to go public by combining with a blank-check company sponsored by finance entrepreneur Betsy Cohen, according to a person familiar with the matter.
abstract: Cohen’s blank-check firm emerged as lead bidder in November
Transaction to open up new phase of growth for investment bank

stories.title: India Plans Spending Boost to Counter Covid Impact
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: India is set to swing from being a cautious spender in 2020 to opening the fiscal floodgates as Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeks to pull Asia’s third-biggest economy back from the worst of the pandemic.
abstract: Finance ministry says not deterred by risks of budget deficit
Spending limits lifted, current budget on path to be expanded

stories.title: These Are the Winners and Losers in Japan’s 2020 Stock Market
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: More time at home, reduced mobility and billionaire Masayoshi Son helped drive stocks in Japan in 2020, as the coronavirus pandemic became the dominating force separating winners from losers.
abstract: Gaming, e-commerce and health plays feature among top gainers
Stocks related to railways, department stores and oil tumbled

stories.title: North Korea Seeks Economic Boost Amid Covid, Sanctions Pain
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un will likely seek fresh impetus for driving growth at a ruling party congress in January after the pandemic added to the pain of sanctions that leave him with a smaller economy than the one he took over nine years ago.
abstract: Kim Jong Un seeks new five year plan at congress in January
Pandemic decimates China trade for Kim’s worst GDP contraction

stories.title: Manhattan Gentrifier Stumbles With Rental Apartment Bankruptcies
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: A real estate firm focused on gentrifying neighborhoods is showing cracks after a group of its apartment buildings in New York’s Upper West Side and Harlem filed for bankruptcy.
abstract: Complexes in Harlem, Upper West Side seek Chapter 11
Lender LoanCore to take over some Emerald Equity buildings

stories.title: Mainland Cash Chasing Hong Kong Stocks After Record Year
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: In a year disrupted by a global pandemic, political upheaval and abrupt setbacks for some of Hong Kong’s biggest stocks, investors point to one constant as to why 2021 looks brighter: relentless levels of money coming in.
abstract: Capital raised via IPOs, secondary listings most in a decade
Investors look to increase exposure to H-shares on valuation
